verses.kjv: Now of the things which we have spoken this is the sum: We have such an high priest, who is set on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens;
verses.ct: Here's the main point of everything we've been saying: We have a high priest like this, one who has taken his seat at the right side of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens.

verses.kjv: A minister of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, and not man.
verses.ct: He serves in the holy place — the true tabernacle that the Lord set up, not any human being.

verses.kjv: For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices: wherefore it is of necessity that this man have somewhat also to offer.
verses.ct: Every high priest is appointed to present gifts and sacrifices, so it's essential that this one also has something to offer.

verses.kjv: For if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, seeing that there are priests that offer gifts according to the law:
verses.ct: If he were on earth, he wouldn't serve as a priest at all, since there are already priests who present gifts as the law requires.

verses.kjv: Who serve unto the example and shadow of heavenly things, as Moses was admonished of God when he was about to make the tabernacle: for, See, saith he, that thou make all things according to the pattern shewed to thee in the mount.
verses.ct: These priests serve in a system that is only a copy and shadow of the heavenly reality. That's why God warned Moses when he was about to construct the tabernacle: "Make sure you build everything according to the design that was shown to you on the mountain."

verses.kjv: But now hath he obtained a more excellent ministry, by how much also he is the mediator of a better covenant, which was established upon better promises.
verses.ct: But as it is, Christ has received a far superior ministry, just as the covenant he mediates is a better one, since it rests on better promises.

verses.kjv: For if that first covenant had been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second.
verses.ct: If that first covenant had been without flaws, there would have been no reason to look for a second one.

verses.kjv: For finding fault with them, he saith, Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah:
verses.ct: But God found the people at fault when he said, "Pay attention — the time is coming, says the Lord, when I will establish a new covenant with the people of Israel and the people of Judah.

verses.kjv: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they continued not in my covenant, and I regarded them not, saith the Lord.
verses.ct: It won't be like the covenant I made with their ancestors on the day I took them by the hand and led them out of Egypt. They didn't remain faithful to my covenant, so I turned away from them, says the Lord.

verses.kjv: For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, saith the Lord; I will put my laws into their mind, and write them in their hearts: and I will be to them a God, and they shall be to me a people:
verses.ct: This is the covenant I will make with the people of Israel when those days arrive, says the Lord: I will place my laws in their minds and inscribe them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people.

verses.kjv: And they shall not teach every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for all shall know me, from the least to the greatest.
verses.ct: No one will need to teach their neighbor or their brother, saying, 'Know the Lord,' because every one of them will know me, from the least important to the most important.

verses.kjv: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their iniquities will I remember no more.
verses.ct: I will show mercy regarding their wrongdoing, and I will never again hold their sins against them."

verses.kjv: In that he saith, A new covenant, he hath made the first old. Now that which decayeth and waxeth old is ready to vanish away.
verses.ct: By calling it a "new" covenant, he declared the first one outdated. And whatever is outdated and aging is about to disappear entirely.
